summary: A scathing critique of the Glazer family's ownership of Manchester United, highlighting financial exploitation and its impact on the club.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person standing in front of a lush, green background with palm trees and a building visible in the distance. The individual is wearing a dark-colored shirt and appears to be speaking directly to the camera. The video is part of a YouTube channel named "The People's Person," as indicated by the logo in the top left corner. The video's title, "PROOF OF THE GLAZERS' THIEVERY AT MAN UNITED," is prominently displayed at the bottom of the screen, along with a subtitle that reads, "Following on from Sam's video exposing the Glazers' strategy at Man United, this video uses research done by Swiss Fanbase showing the true scale of the financial turmoil the Glazers have imposed on our club since 2005." The video also includes a call to action to join the channel's Discord community and a prompt to have your voice heard in the comments. The person in the video is discussing the financial impact of the Glazers on Manchester United, as suggested by the title and subtitle. The video maintains a consistent visual style throughout, with the same background and text elements visible in each frame.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a man speaking in an informative tone. He references a video he made about the Glazer's strategy at Manchester United, directing the listener to watch it. He explains that the Glazer's strategy at Manchester United revolves around achieving a top four finish rather than winning trophies, which he states is a change since the Glazers took over.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man standing in front of a lush, green background with palm trees and a building visible behind him. He is wearing a black shirt and appears to be speaking directly to the camera. The video is a part of a YouTube channel named "The People's Person," as indicated by the logo in the top left corner. The video's title, "Proof of the Glazers' Thievery at Man United," is prominently displayed at the bottom of the screen, along with a subtitle that reads, "Following on from Sam's video exposing the Glazers' strategy at Man United, this video uses research done by Swiss Fanbase showing the true scale of the financial turmoil the Glazers have imposed on our club since 2005." The video also includes a call to action to join their Discord community and a prompt to have your voice heard in the comments. The man is discussing the financial impact of the Glazers on Manchester United, and the video includes images of a stadium and a building, possibly related to the topic being discussed. The video is designed to inform viewers about the financial issues at Manchester United and to encourage engagement with the channel's community.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a passionate male speaker stating his intention to prove that "the Glazers are thieves at Manchester United", referring to a leveraged buyout deal in 2005 and citing research. His tone is assertive, urging listeners to like and share the video, suggesting a call to action, followed by a sentiment that he is not going to "sit by and ignore as it happens." The speaker intends to talk about it and show "the true scale of the thievery" that has occurred since the Glazers took ownership in 2005.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person standing in front of a lush, green background with palm trees and a building visible in the distance. The individual is wearing a black shirt and appears to be speaking directly to the camera. The video is framed with a colorful border that includes various texts and images. On the left side of the frame, there are images of a stadium under construction and a person with the words "MONEY," "GREED," and "POWER" above their head, along with the hashtag "#GLAZERSOUT." The top of the frame includes a URL, "www.thepeoplesperson.com," and a call to action to subscribe, with a red bell icon indicating notifications. The bottom of the frame features a green banner with the text "PROOF OF THE GLAZERS' THIEVERY AT MAN UNITED," followed by a description of the video's content, which discusses the financial impact of the Glazers on Manchester United since 2005. Additionally, there is a blue banner with a Discord logo and a prompt to join their community. The video also includes a tweet from "The Swiss Ramble" discussing the financial aspects of football clubs, with a timestamp of "6:48 am - 14 Sep 2020." The overall atmosphere of the video is informative and critical, focusing on the financial issues surrounding Manchester United and the Glazers' ownership.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker expressing his opinion that the success of Manchester United was "in spite of the Glazers," rather than because of them. He mentions an analysis by "Swiss Ramble" about football and business. He speaks in a casual, conversational tone, and then acknowledges that his analysis may not be enjoyable for fans but emphasizes its importance for understanding.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person standing in front of a lush, green background with trees and a building visible in the distance. The video also features a series of tweets from Swiss Ramble discussing the financial analysis of football clubs in the Premier League. The overall atmosphere is informative, with a focus on discussing the financial aspects of Manchester United's ownership.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with someone counting to five, followed by a male speaker who states that his video is using an analysis that covers the last five years. He continues, explaining that it is about what happened with 20 Premier League clubs. The speaker suggests they will look at all twenty at once to start, focusing on the financing.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a Twitter post from the account 'Swiss Ramble,' dated 14 Sep 2020, discussing the financial benefits of the 20 Premier League clubs over the last five years, highlighting net financing and sources of funding. The post includes a detailed table and a bar chart comparing the financial performance of various clubs. The scene then transitions to a YouTube video titled 'PROOF OF THE GLAZERS' THIEVERY AT MAN UNITED,' featuring a person speaking in front of a tropical backdrop with palm trees. The video's banner includes hashtags like '#GLAZERSOUT' and mentions the financial impact of the Glazers' ownership on Manchester United since 2005. The video encourages viewers to join a Discord community and engage in the comments section. The overall theme revolves around financial analysis and criticism of the Glazers' management at Manchester United.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker with a factual tone states investment figures for several soccer teams, noting that one team had money removed from it. The tone is critical, especially when mentioning that team's owners.

events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features one male speaker with an angry tone. He asserts the club is being used as a "cash cow", dismissing the investment made on signings and claims that the Glazers are taking money out of the club, investing only in "the Glazers' pockets."

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a screenshot of a Twitter post by Swiss Ramble, discussing the financial contributions of seven clubs from their owners, with a bar graph illustrating the amounts. The post highlights the significant funding provided by owners like J.P. Morgan, FFC, and MCF, with specific figures mentioned. The background of the Twitter post is blue, and the text is in white, with hashtags like #FCC193M, #FFC18Bn, and #MCF124m. The scene then transitions to a video featuring a person speaking in front of a lush, green background with a building and trees visible. The overall atmosphere is informative, with a focus on discussing the financial aspects of Manchester United's ownership.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with one male speaker referring to a list and lamenting the position of the football club "United". He criticizes the club's financial state and accuses the owners of taking money out of the club through dividends, claiming "we are the only club to pay dividends to their owners" and that they've paid more to the owners than they paid for players. He questions whether they are thieves. He continues, suggesting that the owners are not using United to win the Premier League again. His tone is critical and frustrated.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person standing in front of a lush, green background with a building visible in the distance. The individual is wearing a dark green shirt and appears to be speaking directly to the camera. Surrounding the person are various graphics and text overlays. On the left side, there is a collage of images, including a building under construction and a person's face with the words "MONEY," "GREED," and "POWER" above it, along with the hashtag "#GLAZERSOUT." Below this collage, a banner reads "PROOF OF THE GLAZERS' THIEVERY AT MAN UNITED," followed by a description of the video's content. The video transitions to a screenshot of a Twitter post by Swiss Ramble, dated September 14, 2020, discussing the financial situation of a football club, with a bar graph illustrating the club's financial figures. The post highlights the club's reliance on loans and the net outflows of £80m and £43m, resulting in a net outflow of £10m. The video maintains a consistent theme of discussing financial issues related to a football club, with a focus on the impact of the Glazers' ownership.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing economics, stating that "it's not just with the dividends that money is leaving the United," adding it's leaving "at a rapid rate." He then instructs the listener to "have a look at this in terms of the external financing." The speaker uses a conversational tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person standing on a balcony with a lush green background, discussing financial issues related to Manchester United. The person is wearing a dark green shirt and is seen gesturing with their hands while speaking. The video includes various graphics and text overlays. One overlay shows a bar graph titled "External Financing (2005-2020)" with a caption explaining the financial situation of the club. Another overlay displays a tweet from Swiss Ramble discussing dividend payments and interest payments to banks. The video also features a banner with the hashtag #GLAZERSOUT and the text "PROOF OF THE GLAZERS' THIEVERY AT MAN UNITED," along with a call to join a Discord community and a prompt to have one's voice heard in the comments. events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing Manchester United's financial losses, mentioning "80 million pounds," "the Glazers bought United," and "interest repayments," suggesting frustration in his tone. He continues by comparing these figures to those of Arsenal and Tottenham Hotspur, stressing that, unlike them, United is paying for the Glazers' purchase loan, labeling the situation as unfair and saying, "it's fucked." The speaker's tone conveys disappointment and anger, underscoring the financial implications of the club's ownership.

He compares their financial situation unfavorably to other clubs like Man City and Liverpool, citing specific figures and highlighting the substantial amounts spent under the Glazers' ownership. The speaker's tone intensifies as he concludes, stating "Fuck the Glazers".

events_list.audio_caption: A man speaks with an exasperated tone, saying that it "pisses me off" that people would say, "oh, you signed Harry Maguire, oh, you signed Aaron Wan-Bissaka," when they don't understand the scale of the "theivery" at United under the Glazers, because these numbers are "insignificant" compared to the "significant theivery", "constant dividends", "interest repayments" and "leverage buyout". He concludes with frustration that there is nothing more he can say or do about it, but it's important not to ignore it.

events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker addressing "a set of fans" and encouraging them to do whatever they can, referencing hashtags and trending topics. He emphasizes his contribution through videos that present evidence about the Glazer's ownership of Manchester United, their strategy, and their financial impact on the club, contrasting this with investments made by other clubs. The speaker expresses the feeling that United is "not a football club anymore", and instead a "business first."
